HTML.description: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the standard markup language for creating web pages.
HTML.usage: Defines the structure and content of web pages.
HTML.example:
Hello, World!

This is an example of HTML.

CSS.description: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is used for styling HTML elements on web pages.
CSS.usage: Controls the presentation, layout, and design of web pages.

JavaScript.description: JavaScript is a scripting language used to create dynamic and interactive web content.
JavaScript.usage: Adds interactivity, manipulates content, and enhances user experience.

Accessibility.description: Accessibility in web development refers to creating websites and applications that can be used by everyone, including people with disabilities.
Accessibility.importance: Ensures equal access and usability for all users.
guidelines: Use semantic HTML for proper structure.
Provide alternative text for images (alt text).
